newsitem.title: UK: English short-story master Pritchett dies at 96.
newsitem.headline: English short-story master Pritchett dies at 96.

text.p: V.S. Pritchett, hailed as one of the great 20th century masters of the English short story, has died at the age of 96, his family said on Friday.
Pritchett, author of more than 40 books of short stories, novels and literary criticism, was hailed by his fellow novelists as a genius.
""He was one of the very greatest English writers of the 20th century," said Martin Amis. Julian Barnes called Pritchett "the best English short story writer of the last 50 years."

Pritchett, who left school at 15, worked as a journalist during the Irish Civil War and later in Spain. He was knighted in 1975 for his services to literature. He had been ill for several months after suffering a stroke.
